unnormalised: EdTech startup, LearnSmart, secures ₹20 Cr in Series A funding led by Sequoia Capital India. The platform boasts a 4.5-star rating on Google Play Store and claims a 90% success rate among students preparing for competitive exams like JEE & NEET. The funding will be used to expand LearnSmart’s regional language offerings and develop AI-powered personalized learning modules.
normalised: E-D-Tech startup, Learn Smart, secures rupee twenty crore in Series A funding led by Sequoia Capital India. The platform boasts a four point five-star rating on Google Play Store and claims a ninety percent success rate among students preparing for competitive exams like J-E-E and N-E-E-T. The funding will be used to expand Learn Smart’s regional language offerings and develop A-I-powered personalized learning modules.

unnormalised: LearnSmart currently offers courses in Maths, Science, and English for students in grades 6th to 12th, aligned with the CBSE and ICSE curricula. They have partnered with over 500 schools across India, providing online learning resources and teacher training programs. Founder, Rohan Sharma, an IIT Delhi alumnus, aims to reach 1 million students by 2025.
normalised: Learn Smart currently offers courses in Maths, Science, and English for students in grades sixth to twelfth, aligned with the C-B-S-E and I-C-S-E curricula. They have partnered with over five hundred schools across India, providing online learning resources and teacher training programs. Founder, Rohan Sharma, an I-I-T Delhi alumnus, aims to reach one million students by two thousand and twenty five.

unnormalised: The EdTech sector in India is booming, with projections estimating a market size of $10 billion USD by 2027. Several other startups, like Byju’s and Vedantu, are also competing for a share of this growing market. LearnSmart differentiates itself by focusing on affordability and accessibility for students in Tier-2 and Tier-3 cities.
normalised: The E-D-Tech sector in India is booming, with projections estimating a market size of dollar ten billion U-S-D by two thousand and twenty seven. Several other startups, like Byju’s and Vedantu, are also competing for a share of this growing market. Learn Smart differentiates itself by focusing on affordability and accessibility for students in Tier-two and Tier-three cities.

unnormalised: According to a press release dated 15/07/2024, the company is also planning to introduce coding and robotics courses for younger children in the near future. This move aims to capitalize on the increasing demand for STEM education and prepare students for the jobs of tomorrow.
normalised: According to a press release dated fifteenth July two thousand and twenty four, the company is also planning to introduce coding and robotics courses for younger children in the near future. This move aims to capitalize on the increasing demand for S-T-E-M education and prepare students for the jobs of tomorrow.
